articles.title: G.S. Kim Jong Il enjoys KPA choir's performance
G.S. Kim Jong Il receives film makers
articles.content:
G.S. Kim Jong Il enjoys KPA choir's performance
  Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il saw a performance given by the merited choir of the KPA song and dance ensemble on Friday.
   Among the audience were Director of the KPA General Political Department Jo Myong Rok, Chief of the KPA General staff Kim Yong Chun and KPA generals.
   Secretaries Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam and Kim Yong Sun and other senior officials of the WPK Central Committee were also present.
   The programme included "Kim Jong Il, Our Destiny" and "Millions will become human bombs."
   The performance represented the great pride of the army and people of Korea in having another great leader General Kim Jong Il.
   Greatly satisfied to see the revolutionary and militant performance inspiring the army and people with confidence in victory, optimism and strong courage and demonstrating the invincible spirit of the heroic KPA, General Kim Jong Il congratulated the performers on their good job.
   He said the merited choir, very popular in the army and the people, has greatly encouraged them to victory and feats as the standard-bearer and bugler of struggle in each period and stage of the Korean revolution.
   He expressed great expectation and conviction that all the members of the choir will invigorate revolutionary artistic activities so as to fully display its might as a militant unit of artistes also in the forced march for the final victory.

articles.title: Book "Legends about Great Man" published in S. Korea
articles.content:
G.S. Kim Jong Il receives film makers
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Friday received makers of the working class parts of the multi-part feature film "the Nation and Destiny".
   Present at the meeting were Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam and Kim Yong Sun, secretaries of the WPK Central Committee, and officials concerned.
   General Secretary Kim Jong Il highly praised all the creators, artistes and officials for having made the working class parts as a grand monumental masterpiece.
   He said they produced some ten parts in a short time and on the highest level, the parts which vividly show the revolutionary spirit of the heroic Korean working class and give a powerful political and ideological weapon to the army and people in the forced march for the final victory.
   He also said it is a great pride and pleasure of the Korean people to have such masterpieces as "the Nation and Destiny" and that this proud achievement of weighty importance in the history of literature and art fully demonstrates the validity and great vitality of the WPK's Juche-based literary and art policies and line.
   He noted that as the multi-part film is a treasure which should be handed down long along with the history of the Korean nation, the rest of the film should be created perfectly in the ideological and artistic aspect. He then gave important tasks to be taken as guidelines in film making.

articles.title: Wreaths before bust of Choe Kwang
articles.content:
Book "Legends about Great Man" published in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- A book "Legends about Great Man" was published by the members of the Chongsong society active in Mapho district on the occasion of the 56th birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation quoted information of the Seoul city committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea as saying.
   The book carries 56 legends concerning the birth of General Kim Jong Il, his immortal feats for the history of the nation and his benevolent politics.
   The book is evoking great repercussions upon people from all walks of life in South Korea for it was published before the auspicious holiday of February, the information said.

articles.title: Fair and aboveboard, realistic measure
articles.content:
Wreaths before bust of Choe Kwang
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- A wreath was laid before the bust of Choe Kwang, communist revolutionary fighter, at the Mt. Taesong Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Feb. 21 on the occasion of his 1st death anniversary.
   Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Jo Myong Rok, Director of the General Political Department of the Korean People's Army, Kim Yong Chun, Chief of the KPA general staff, generals, officers and bereaved families.
   Wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and units of the KPA and bunches of flowers were laid before his bust.
